FacilityName: THE DODGE CITY COOP EXCHANGE-Ingalls South

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

A.     Introduction

Dodge City Coop is a supplier of fertilizer, agrichemical, and other inputs to farmers. Bulk and packaged products are received via transport trucks and stored for the eventual sale to farmers. This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to plant personnel or contractors due to the RMP covered process. There have been no accidents in the past 5 years involved in the RMP covered process.



B.     Accidental Release Prevention Policies and Program

This Dodge City Coop strives to meet or exceed compliance with state and federal anhydrous ammonia regulations. Training is provided for each new hire and re-hire employee involved in the process and every three years as required by federal regulations. The anhydrous ammonia tanks and associated equipment are inspected annually following recommended industry and engineering frequencies.  The facility strives to meet current industry accepted standards.



C.    Emergency Response Policies and Programs

Each employee involved in the process is trained to be familiar with the emergency action procedures through safety reviews and other safety meetings. Dodge City Coop has an Emergency Action Plan, covered by 29CFR 1910.38, which covers accidental releases, natural disasters, security incidents and other emergency practices and procedures. The Emergency Action Plan for this facility is reviewed and updated on an annual basis as part of a comprehensive review process. The Emergency Action Plan for this facility includes specific instructions for the employees regarding the response to an emergency. The procedures provided in the Emergency Action Plan are shared with all employees and followed in the event of an emergency. The local emergency planning committee and fire department personnel are furnished a copy of the Tier II's, Maximum Intended Inventory, Worst Case and Alternate Release Scenarios for this facility, and invited for a tour on an annual basis

.



D.    Worse-Case Scenario / Alternative-Case Scenario

This facility has developed a worse-case and an alternative-case scenario however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.  Considerations have been taken with Gray County and the LEPC in the event of a worst-case scenario release.



E.    Five Year Accident History

This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to any of its employees as a result of the RMP covered process. In addition, there have been no accidents resulting in releases of anhydrous ammonia with off-site consequences during the entire operation period. Extensive programs and procedures are in place to maintain this record.



F.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Management of the Dodge City Coop continuously look for ways to enhance the safety of this location. Annual equipment inspections are conducted.  Environmental Safety & Health audits are conducted every three years with a detailed description of the findings.  The Dodge City Coop will continually strive to comply with most current industry accepted practices and to ensure the safety of our employees, neighbors, and the environment.  



G.    Summary

The employees of the Dodge City Coop are extremely proud of our safety record and vast improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety. We believe with our programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel, we will maintain our safety record and our safe facility environment for the public, our customers, and our employees for years to come.
